title: 'One Direction would have killed me': Liam Payne says he was 'overworked and a reclusive pop star'
text:
Liam Payne thinks being in One Direction 'would have killed him' because he was so burnt out by being 'overworked'.

The singer, 26, was a member of the chart-topping boy band between 2010 and 2015, before the group went on an indefinite hiatus following the departure of Zayn Malik, 26, eight months earlier.

Liam now admits he became 'a reclusive pop star' and had 'no personal life' during his time in the group as he spoke about the pressures of finding fame as a teenager during an appearance on Jessie Ware's Table Manners podcast.

Tough: Liam Payne thinks being in One Direction 'would have killed him' because he was so burnt out by being 'overworked' (pictured last month)

Liam said: 'We [One Direction] were definitely overworked. I had no personal life, I learnt nothing about myself.

'I remember getting to therapy and the guy was like, "What do you like to do?" I haven't got a clue.

'I just lived so long as this reclusive pop star who was afraid of people, who just stayed inside all the time. I needed to stop, definitely. It would have killed me.'

Liam added that since leaving the band and embarking upon his solo career he's 'spent the last two years in and out of music trying to be a person'.

Fame: One Direction (pictured left to right are Louis Tomlinson, Liam Payne, Harry Styles, Zayn Malik and Niall Horan in 2012) were formed on the X Factor in 2010 after the members were put together to create a boy band on the hit singing show

One Direction was formed in 2010 on the X Factor after the five members - then just teenagers aged between 16 and 19 - were put together to make a boy band.

The band finished third in the singing competition but went on to have international success including world tours and four UK number one singles.

After Zayn Malik, now 26, announced that he was going to leave the band because he wanted 'to be a normal 22-year-old who is able to relax and have some private time out of the spotlight' in 2015 the other four members continued making music.

However later that year Louis, Liam, Harry and Niall announced they would be taking an extended hiatus, with their last performance together happening in December.

The Strip That Down singer also discussed how his relationship with songstress Cheryl, 36 - the mother of his son Bear, two - was put under pressure by their fame.

'Overworked': The singer, 26, was a member of the chart-topping boy band between 2010 and 2015 (pictured with L-R Zayn, Louis, Harry and Niall in 2013)

He said: 'I think we kind of rubbed off on each other a little bit in that way. In a bad way, actually. All of that stuff puts so much pressure on a relationship.

'For her, if you were going out somewhere, it would take so long to get out of the door because you're just so worried.'

The couple dated between February 2016 and July 2018 and welcomed their first child Bear in March 2017.

Although no longer together, the exes co-parent their young son, and are on amicable terms over a year on from their break-up.

The ex factor: The singer also discussed how his relationship with songstress Cheryl, 36 - the mother of his son Bear, two - was put under pressure by their fame (pictured in 2018)

It had been previously claimed that Liam said on the podcast that he broke up with Cheryl around the release of For You in January 2018, despite attending the BRITs together the following month and announcing their split in July later that year.

However a representative for Cheryl told MailOnline: 'Liam doesn’t say on the podcast that they split up in January or at the time of release of With You.

'The couple 100 per cent split in July 2018 as was well documented.'

Moving on: Liam and Cheryl dated between February 2016 and July 2018, the pair welcomed their first child Bear in March 2017

Liam is now dating Maya Henry, 19, with the pair making their red carpet debut at a launch event for Rita Ora's Escada collaboration at Paris Fashion Week in September.

He said at the time: '[Maya's] awesome ... it's kind of got to the point with my life, where I'm like, screw this. It's not worth my happiness.

'If someone is going to take a picture, someone is going to do something. The difference is with her, she's so relaxed that it helps me relax in a situation.'
description: Liam Payne, 26, has opened up about his time in One Direction saying that he 'lived so long as this reclusive pop star who was afraid of people ... I needed to stop, definitely. It would have killed me.'
